item.title: How to Unlock Mina and Fabius in Monster Hunter Wilds
item.description:
The ability to take on hunts solo in Monster Hunter Wilds is more accessible than ever thanks to the game's support hunter system. This gives you the ability to hire various hunters you've progressed the story with as effective backup during hunts, giving you an alternative to randomized players or just your Palico.

Some of the latest support hunters to join the fray in Monster Hunter Wilds are Mina and Fabius, the legendary leader of the Hunter's Guild himself. Here's how to bring them along on your hunts.

How Support Hunters Work in Monster Hunter Wilds

Support Hunters, as their name suggests, function as a supportive backup for your hunter when you embark on hunts solo, or at least with fewer than three other players. As you progress through the main story and certain sidequests, more support hunters will become available for you to call upon, and each of them has their own weapon setup.

To make support hunters join your own hunter in battle, you need to send out an SOS Flare either at the beginning of a mission or during it. You can do this manually via your ability wheel or set the action to trigger automatically at the start of all missions, ensuring that support hunters always join. To do this, speak to Alma (or Erik if you opt to have him as your Handler) or visit the Quest Counter in the Grand Hub.

Go to the 'Settings' option listed at the top (seen above). Next, select 'Multiplayer Settings' and choose either 'Players & Support Hunters' or 'Only Support Hunters' if you'd prefer to stick solely with NPC support. To make things even easier and more self-sufficient, go to 'Automatic SOS Flare' and select 'On' to always automatically fire an SOS Flare at the start of every mission. This relieves you of having to remember to do it each hunt.

Finally, as of Title Update 2, there is an option to 'Select Support Hunters' in the mission departure menu. This allows you to choose specific support hunters for your current mission

How to Unlock Mina in Monster Hunter Wilds

Mina is a Sword & Shield support hunter who automatically becomes available for the game as of the release of Title Update 2. To unlock her for your roster of support hunters, you first need to complete the main mission "A Hunter's Pride" early on in Chapter 1-4. This gives you the opportunity to recruit Mina from the beginning of the story.

How to Unlock Fabius in Monster Hunter Wilds

Fabius is a familiar face who first makes his appearance at the start of the main story as the leader of the Hunter's Guild. While he makes brief alliances with your party during certain story mission objectives, the ability to recruit him as an actual support hunter is a newer feature. His preferred weapon of choice is the Lance.

While Mina became permanently available as of Title Update 2's release, Fabius is currently only slated to be available for the Festival of Accord: Flamefete event, which lasts from July 23rd until August 5th. So make sure you take the opportunity to test him on some hunts while you can.

item.title: Where to use the Rebel Camp Key in Wuchang: Fallen Feathers
item.description:
Wuchang: Fallen Feathers has a lot of layered areas that are opened up further as you get new key items that open new pathways. While some of the additional areas are optional, some are the main path to the next major boss and require you to find specific key items before progressing the main story.

While exploring Cloudspire, you'll come across more and more rebels, along with their camp. While in the Rebel Camp, one of the first enemies you'll come across will drop the Rebel Camp Key. Here's where to find the gate that the Rebel Camp Key opens, along with what's on the other side of the gate.

Where to Use the Rebel Camp Key in Wuchang: Fallen Feathers

The Rebel Camp Key is obtained right near the Rebel Camp Shrine. Go back to the Shrine and enter the dream, making sure you're fully healed and have all your healing charges. From the Shrine, turn around and go down the ladder ; with the height, you can also drop down without taking any damage. Follow the path to the left, though be careful and move slowly as there are multiple mines along the path.

Stay to the left when you reach the next clearing, and also kill the bird straight ahead to get the Aurum Feather. Going to the right takes you to the mines, which is optional, but a good place to level up before the boss you're about to face. To the left will be a large wooden gate, which can be opened using the Rebel Camp Key, but know that right when you use the key, a cutscene will start afterwards which starts the next boss fight.

What's Inside the Rebel Camp Gate in Wuchang: Fallen Feathers?

Inside the gate is the next major story boss, General of the North - Ai Nengqi . While he is a bit bigger and slower than some of the previous bosses in the game up until this point, he can prove to be just as much of a threat.

  • Bring fire resistance armor as his second phase lights his sword on fire.
  • Stay close to him while fighting, as his bow attacks don't have many openings.
  • Dodge towards his back as he doesn't turn fast.

After beating this boss, there's nothing else inside the arena, but killing this boss was still required to open up the next area. Beating him will play a cutscene of the drawbridge to the main castle coming down , which can be reached by going back to the Cloudspire Outskirts Shrine.

item.title: Where to Find Medicine Case for Magalhaes in Wuchang Fallen Feathers
item.description:
After completely exploring Cloudspire and defeating the final boss in the region, players will be able to teleport to the entrance of the cave that leads to Mt. Zhenwu in Wuchang: Fallen Feathers . As players progress through this region, they will come across the Refugee Camp.

This camp serves as an important hub where NPCs like Wu Gang and Tao Qing will relocate, allowing you to buy and sell items while continuing your exploration . It is also here that players will encounter Magalhaes , and this guide provides information on where to find his Medicine Case in Wuchang: Fallen Feathers .

Where to Find Medicine Case for Magalhaes in Wuchang Fallen Feathers

From the Shrine, turn around and make your way down the narrow path until you come across a wooden bridge that you must cross in order to reach the opposite side. Immediately after crossing the bridge, you will notice a ladder to your left—climb it and continue along the linear path ahead. Proceed forward until you spot an enemy in the distance that continuously spawns additional foes and launches a lotus projectile toward you. You can choose to engage and eliminate this enemy if desired.

Once the enemy has been dealt with, turn to your left from the direction you ascended, and you will see a few crates positioned near some jars. The Medicine Case you were tasked to retrieve will be located beside them . With the Medicine Case now in your possession, begin making your way back to the Refugee Camp.

It is worth noting that the cave directly in front of you contains a large chest housing a Lost Remains , which you should definitely collect before heading back to Magalhaes .

Retrace your steps back to the Refugee Camp and speak with Magalhaes regarding the Medicine Case. As a reward for your efforts, he will give you an Arnica Ointment —a rare consumable item in the game that not only restores a small portion of your health but also helps alleviate Poise Break buildup .

item.title: Grand Theft Auto 6 Can Turn Its Release Date Confusion Into a Happy Little Accident
item.description:
The wait for Grand Theft Auto 6 is growing shorter with each passing day, as many gamers eagerly await Rockstar's newest addition to the beloved long-running franchise. Grand Theft Auto 6 has been at the front of a lot of gamers' minds, and now that the PlayStation Store has officially listed the title, it feels more real than ever at the moment.

That wasn't all that got GTA 6 fans excited, though. For a moment, the storefront listing made it look like GTA 6 might release a day earlier in certain regions. Reddit user JaivianCraft noticed that GTA 6 was listed with a May 25 release date instead of May 26, but this was quickly explained away by another Redditor. User TomRodders replied, "OP is most likely just looking at a different storefront. If I look at the New Zealand PS store, it will say 25th at 1PM BST and if I look at the UK store, it will say 26th at midnight. It’s all just 12am local to the timezone you’re looking at." Although this moment of excitement was quickly brought back down to reality, Rockstar could actually use this confusion to its advantage.

Rockstar Should Drop Grand Theft Auto 6 at the Same Time Across the Globe

Shaking Up the Industry's Release Standard

In this day and age, games tend to go live at midnight on the day of their release, with New Zealand being the first country to revel in launches because of its timezone. This has even created a method that some gamers like to call the "New Zealands trick." Players simply change their console's timezone settings to reflect New Zealand, giving them access to the game early. It's not exactly the most complicated trick, but it gets the job done. As the anticipation for GTA 6 heats up, there are bound to be plenty of gamers who opt for the New Zealand trick, so they can experience it as soon as possible.

However, it would be fun if Rockstar subverted everyone's expectations and just dropped the game all at once. While New Zealand enjoys GTA 6 at midnight, New York City could be getting it at 8AM. Everyone getting access to the game at the same time would be an exciting moment that catches the gaming world by surprise, but there is one major drawback.

On the flip side, it would be a huge bummer if someone was busy at work and found out that GTA 6 was available, but they just couldn't jump in at the moment. With a game as big and highly anticipated as GTA 6 , there are bound to be plenty of gamers who are already gearing up to take off work in order to spend some sweet quality time with the title during its launch week.

Rockstar has yet to reveal GTA 6 's online counterpart.

Despite Two Trailers, GTA 6 is Still Shrouded in Mystery

The only two trailers that Rockstar has released promise a story filled with crime, action, and even romance, but many of the finer details still remain under wraps. That's understandable, considering the scope of GTA 6 , but with less than a year left until launch, there are still so many unanswered questions.

For the first time in the franchise's history, GTA 6 will star a couple as its protagonists, Jason and Lucia.

Rockstar's deafening silence only makes the excitement that much more palpable. As the year continues and Rockstar revs up its engines to start promoting the game more heavily, it will be exciting to see what fresh insight is given ahead of launch. Only time will tell, but for now, GTA 6 remains fertile soil for speculation and theories to grow.

item.title: Should You Follow the Course of Destiny in Wuchang Fallen Feathers or Challenge the Threads of Fate (Hillswatch)?
item.description:
As players defeat Commander Honglan inside the Tang Emperor Palace , they will gain access to the Reverent Temple Key , which allows them to travel to Cloudspire and continue Wuchang 's journey there. Upon arriving at the first Shrine located at Hillswatch , players will find a weeping lady who has a quest for them, alongside a stone door to the right of the elevator.

This Mysterious Door , similar to the one in Tang Emperor Palace, offers two choices, each with a different outcome. This guide offers information on what players can expect upon choosing one of the options in Wuchang: Fallen Feathers .

Should You Follow the Course of Destiny in Wuchang Fallen Feathers or Challenge the Threads of Fate (Hillswatch)?

The Mysterious Door is located very close to the Hillswatch Shrine , so even if you happened to miss it during your initial exploration of the area, you can easily return and look to the side of the elevator to spot it. Upon interacting with the gate, you will be presented with two distinct options:

  • Follow the course of destiny
  • Challenge the threads of fate

Selecting the first option in this Soulslike RPG will cause the gate to open , and a black fog will envelop and teleport the player to a scaffolding area, from where they can descend toward the Mort Grotto Shrine . It is important to note that this shrine is not exclusive to this choice, as players can reach it through normal means by slightly deviating from the main path. This essentially means that the first option grants early access to a location that will become available shortly after, making the choice relatively insignificant and not particularly worthwhile .

Choosing the second option, on the other hand, will open the door and provide access to the mine area that players previously traversed while making their way toward Cloudspire. This segment of the mine is a small, hidden section that cannot be accessed by any other means and contains two Soulslike collectible items for players to obtain. These items are:

  • Kong Wine ×1
  • Bridal Veil
  • Bridal Corset
  • Bridal Shackles
  • Bridal Dress

The Bridal Dress does not offer great physical damage reduction, but if players want to wear it for appearance alone, they can alter their outfits to make it work.
